chargeHist.descr: Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $500 but does not Exceed $10,000)
Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $500 but does not Exceed $10,000)
Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value does not Exceed $500)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kameron J Simpson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value does not Exceed $500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.82(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: Case 22CF615

miscConds.notes: Absolute sobriety. Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent. Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Pay all court costs and supervision fees. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due. Collections may include income assignment. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
No contact with victim business except for restitution purposes.

charges.descr: Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value does not Exceed $500)
